text: Words and phrases not included in statement: "I apologize" or "I'm sorry" or "Perpetrators of abuse are responsible for their actions."
author: lkmcgann

text: Important note: Barbra Streisand says she believes the accusers. She defends Jackson, anyway.
author: lkmcgann

text: Actual Diana Ross quote: "STOP IN THE NAME OF LOVE" (Criticizing Michael Jackson) https://www.vox.com/2019/3/23/18278530/barbra-streisand-diana-ross-michael-jackson-didnt-kill-them-leaving-neverland-sexual-abuse-twitter …
author: lkmcgann

text: Woa deep cut. I remember Juice Club.
author: lkmcgann

text: Don't worry, it was healthy in the 90s.
author: lkmcgann

text: I’m not shocked to read these gross comments. Powerful people get away with sexual abuse for a variety of reasons, including because the other powerful people in their industry/institution/org who could challenge them don’t want to.
author: lkmcgann

text: I still know every recipe from my Jamba Juice years in the 90s. No one seems interested in how to blend up a high cal/high carb drink these days.
author: lkmcgann

text: Criticizing Biden for considering a gimmick neglects the fact that a campaign itself is a gimmick.
author: lkmcgann

text: What happened to “I’m using my own money”?
author: lkmcgann

text: The “average” GOP voter is old. That’s who’s watching network TV and thinks Dukakis and the tank was yesterday.
author: lkmcgann

text: Oof. They aren’t just figuratively selling bad information about vaccines to desperate parents. They’re literally selling dubious products to them at a profit.
author: lkmcgann

text: Kellyanne Conway is a powerful figure who deserves genuine political coverage. This piece does as much a disservice to her as anyone expecting to read it and learn who she is.
author: lkmcgann

text: Conway's blueberry corsage from her days as a beauty queen has nothing to do with her White House role, which is to outright lie, if necessary, to protect the president. The range of issues includes: immigrants, health care, monetary policy, Trump's contacts with Russia...
author: lkmcgann

text: Last, but not least, write about women who are ruthless political actors as ruthless political actors. The piece promises to tell us how Conway has survived so long in the Trump White House, but then pivots to telling us...
author: lkmcgann

text: One other way to write about powerful women is to ask a different set of questions than the tired double-standard questions like, say, this:
author: lkmcgann

text: The way to signal that a woman is powerful is to write about her as if she is powerful. A gimmicky hashtag undermines the point it's trying to make.
author: lkmcgann

text: This hashtag reminds me of when lipstick smears were big all over lady content logos.
author: lkmcgann

text: Amy Schumer’s special includes a shoutout to “Lindsey Mammo-Graham” as she touches her breast.
author: lkmcgann

text: I'd be interested to know how many pads or tampons this guy thinks a woman needs, on average, each month. I'd also like to know what he thinks that number is for women with conditions that cause heavier flows. He seems to be a real expert.
author: lkmcgann

text: 2nd half of lawmaker's quote on a bill to require menstruation products in jails: "They have a right to have these and they have them. If that wasn’t the case, then I would be supporting the motion, but they do.”
author: lkmcgann

text: My exposure to country club living is pretty limited, but it seems more luxurious than, say, dealing with menstruation without sanitary products.
author: lkmcgann

text: 1st half of a quote from a lawmaker on a bill requiring menstruation products for women in jail (ie: presumed innocent while awaiting trial): "...the jail system and the correctional system was never meant to be a country club."
author: lkmcgann

text: I don’t know this one.
author: lkmcgann

text: The Post’s piece on how Fetanyl deaths became a crisis is reminding me how critical it is to remember what matters in a hectic “news cycle.” https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2018/national/amp-stories/fentanyl-the-deadly-drug-haunting-america/ …
author: lkmcgann

text: Democrats are at odds over whether to embrace changing attitudes about power at the same time they're trying to defeat Donald Trump in 2020. One side sees a conflict between the two goals. The other doesn't.
author: lkmcgann

text: Good take

text: That’s not the same shirt. The tag is totally different, even.
author: lkmcgann

text: I got into college on the level. Pretending to row a boat in front of a green screen was just part of the application process in the 90s.
author: lkmcgann

text: "The fraud worked because the whole system is corrupt." Read @libbyanelson

text: Bubba the Love Sponge, it turns out, is a person.

text: I didn’t know about Curie either. Teamwork
author: lkmcgann

text: Thread @dapostrophe @SamaraKlar

text: I didn't think there'd be an actual answer!
author: lkmcgann

text: I've never attended SXSW. I've only ever thought about it in the context of pressure campaigns to get me to vote for panels. When did it become a Democratic primary battleground?
author: lkmcgann

text: It turns out there's a robust Jeopardy! alumnae network. I've enjoyed talking with so many of you. I'm looking for more women who appeared on J! If that's you, please email me! laura@vox.com
author: lkmcgann
